name: Sugar Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract until combined.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Mix until dough forms.
Roll out dough on a floured surface and cut into shapes using cookie cutters.
Place cookies on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until edges are lightly golden. Cool completely before decorating.
notes: Decorate with royal icing or sprinkles for a festive touch.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Scoop tablespoonfuls of dough and roll into balls.
Place dough balls on a baking sheet and flatten with a fork in a crisscross pattern.
Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
notes: For extra crunch, use chunky peanut butter.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract until combined.
Gradually mix in dry ingredients until fully incorporated.
Fold in raisins.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until edges are golden. Cool on wire racks.
notes: Substitute raisins with dried cranberries for a twist.

name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract until combined.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Mix until dough forms.
In a small bowl, mix cinnamon and sugar for rolling.
Shape dough into balls and roll in cinnamon sugar mixture.
Place on baking sheets and bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
notes: Ensure cookies remain soft by slightly underbaking.
